Stay Aware: Be mindful of your surroundings and trust your instincts.
Stay Close: Stick to well-populated areas and avoid isolated places.
Buddy System: When possible, travel with a friend or family member.
Know Emergency Numbers: Teach your kids how to call 911 and other emergency numbers.
Avoid Strangers: Teach children not to accept gifts or rides from strangers.
Safe Routes: Discuss safe routes from school or other destinations with your child.
Security Measures: Choose schools, child care facilities, and camps with good security measures.
Check References: When hiring babysitters, check references and recommendations.
Practice Saying “No”: Teach kids to say “no” forcefully if approached by a stranger.
Child ID Information: Keep recent photos, height, weight, and fingerprints on hand for identification.
